title: Authors and Citation
text: Ewan Carr. Author, maintainer. Gordon Forbes. Author, maintainer. Ridwan Olaniran. Author, maintainer. Diana Shamsutdinova. Author. Daniel Stahl. Author. Sarah Markham. Author. Felix Zimmer. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carr E, Forbes G, Olaniran R, Shamsutdinova D, Stahl D, Markham S, Zimmer F (2025). pmsims: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools Prediction Models. R package version 1.0.0, https://pmsims-package.github.io/pmsims/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pmsims: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models},   author = {Ewan Carr and Gordon Forbes and Ridwan Olaniran and Diana Shamsutdinova and Daniel Stahl and Sarah Markham and Felix Zimmer},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://pmsims-package.github.io/pmsims/}, }

what: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models
title: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models
text: pmsims R package estimating much data needed develop reliable generalisable prediction models. uses flexible, simulation-based methods examine performance changes sample size via repeated data generation, model fitting, validation. aim pmsims support study planning feasibility assessment quantifying sample sizes required achieve adequate discrimination, calibration, parameter precision. current version focuses regression-based prediction models continuous, binary, time--event outcomes. Authors & contributors. package developed King’s College London (Department Biostatistics & Health Informatics) input researchers, clinicians, patient partners. learn wider project, visit pmsims project website.

title: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("pmsims-package/pmsims")

title: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models
code: library(pmsims)  # Explore performance across sample sizes for a binary outcome using logistic regression set.seed(123)  print(res) plot(res)

title: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models
text: welcome questions, suggestions, collaboration enquiries.

title: Simulation-based Sample Size Tools for Prediction Models
text: work supported National Institute Health Care Research (NIHR) Research Patient Benefit (RfPB) Programme. views expressed authors necessarily NIHR Department Health Social Care.

what: Title Create default data generating functions — default_data_generators
title: Title Create default data generating functions — default_data_generators
text: Title Create default data generating functions

title: Title Create default data generating functions — default_data_generators
code: default_data_generators(opts)

title: Title Create default data generating functions — default_data_generators
text: opts list options used data generating function. Must include type either "binary", "continuous", "survival". Arguments passed data generating function must stored list item named args. options can passed different default generators see generate_continuous_data, generate_binary_data, generate_survival_data.

title: Title Create default data generating functions — default_data_generators
text: function default arguments set values passed opts

text: object class list length 3.

text: outcome type outcome, possible options : "binary".

title: default_model_generators — default_models
code: default_model_generators("binary") #> Error in default_model_generators("binary"): could not find function "default_model_generators"

title: Title — default_tune
text: Title

title: Title — default_tune
code: default_tune(   tune_param,   max_sample_size,   large_sample_performance,   data_function,   model_function,   metric_function,   tune_args = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Title — default_tune
text: tune_param name tuning parameter data generating model max_sample_size maximum sample size used simulations large_sample_performance target large sample performance data_function data generating funciton model_function estimation model function metric_function performance metric function model tuned . tune_args list arguments may include interval, large_n, tolerance, max_interval_expansion. overide defaults

title: Title — default_tune
text: optimal value tuning parameter

title: Title Simulate Binary Data — generate_binary_data
text: Title Simulate Binary Data

title: Title Simulate Binary Data — generate_binary_data
code: generate_binary_data(   n,   beta_signal,   n_signal_parameters,   noise_parameters,   predictor_type,   predictor_prop = NULL,   baseline_prob )

title: Title Simulate Binary Data — generate_binary_data
text: n Sample size beta_signal Association signal predictors outcome n_signal_parameters Number predictors non zero association outcome @param noise_parameters Number predictors association outcome predictor_type Type predictor, can "continuous" "binary." predictor_prop predictor type binary, probability predictor taking value 1 baseline_prob Baseline probability outcome (ie. probability predicors 0)

title: Title Simulate Binary Data — generate_binary_data
text: data frame one outcome column n_signal_parameters + noise_parameters predictor columns

title: Title Simulate Binary Data — generate_binary_data
code: generate_binary_data(n = 100, n_signal_parameters = 5, noise_parameters = 5, predictor_type = "continuous", beta_signal = 0.1, baseline_prob = 0.1) #> Error in generate_binary_data(n = 100, n_signal_parameters = 5, noise_parameters = 5,     predictor_type = "continuous", beta_signal = 0.1, baseline_prob = 0.1): argument "mu_lp" is missing, with no default

title: Title Simulate Survival Data — generate_survival_data
text: n Sample size beta_signal Association signal predictors outcome n_signal_parameters Number predictors non zero association outcome @param noise_parameters Number predictors association outcome predictor_type Type predictor, can "continuous" "binary." predictor_prop predictor type binary, probability predictor taking value 1 baseline_hazard Baseline Hazard censoring_rate Early drop /censoring rate

title: Title Simulate Survival Data — generate_survival_data
text: data frame time ("time"), event status ("event") (0 = censored, 1 = event), n_signal_parameters + noise_parameters predictor columns ("x1", "x2", ... .)

code: generate_binary_data(n = 100, n_signal_parameters = 5, noise_parameters = 5, predictor_type = "continuous", beta_signal = 0.1, baseline_prob = 0.1) #> Error in generate_binary_data(n = 100, n_signal_parameters = 5, noise_parameters = 5,     predictor_type = "continuous", beta_signal = 0.1, baseline_prob = 0.1): argument "mu_lp" is missing, with no default

what: Calculate the minimum sample size required to develop a prediction model — simulate_binary
title: Calculate the minimum sample size required to develop a prediction model — simulate_binary
text: Minimum working example using mlpwr package

title: Calculate the minimum sample size required to develop a prediction model — simulate_binary
code: simulate_binary(   n_signal_parameters,   baseline_prob,   min_sample_size,   max_sample_size,   large_sample_performance,   minimum_threshold = 0.1,   noise_parameters = 0,   predictor_type = "continuous",   predictor_prop = NULL,   metric = "auc",   model = "glm",   se_final = 0.005,   n_reps_total = NULL,   tune_param = NULL,   ... )

title: Calculate the minimum sample size required to develop a prediction model — simulate_binary
text: n_signal_parameters Number predictors non zero association outcome @param noise_parameters Number predictors association outcome baseline_prob Baseline probability outcome (ie. probability predicors 0) min_sample_size minimum sample size used simulations max_sample_size maximum sample size used simulations large_sample_performance desired performance large sample (metric defined tune_metric_function). may specified place tune_param. data generating model tuned desired performance obtained n equal max_sample_size. predictor_type Type predictor, can "continuous" "binary." predictor_prop predictor type binary, probability predictor taking value 1 tune_param tuning parameter passed data generating function ... options passed simulate_custom() data_generating_function function two parameters, n tuning parameter, returns data model function model_function function takes object returned data generating function fits analysis model interest. metric_function function takes test dataset model object arguments returns performance metricß target_performance desired performance prediction model test_n sample size used testing model performance tune_args named list arguments passed tune_generate_data.R. Possible arguments large_n, min_tune_arg, max_tune_arg, max_interval_expansion, tolerance. See tune_generate_data details. tune_metric_function metric_function used tuning model. may differ metric function used determining sample size. n_reps_totalThe number simulation reps final_estimate_se standard error estimate model performance minimum sample size. Either nreps specified. n_sample_sizes number different sample sizes simulations carried sample size n_init number different sample sizes initialization (updates)

title: Calculate the minimum sample size required to develop a prediction model — simulate_binary
text: list results form simulation

title: Calculate the minimum sample size required for a continous outcome — simulate_continuous
text: n_signal_parameters Number predictors non zero association outcome @param noise_parameters Number predictors association outcome predictor_type Type predictor, can "continuous" "binary." predictor_prop predictor type binary, probability predictor taking value 1

what: Simulate Custom 'simulate_custom' is the interface for pmsims at the most basic level. It performs no processing of arguments and allows all possible options to be customised. — simulate_custom
title: Simulate Custom 'simulate_custom' is the interface for pmsims at the most basic level. It performs no processing of arguments and allows all possible options to be customised. — simulate_custom
text: Simulate Custom 'simulate_custom' interface pmsims basic level. performs processing arguments allows possible options customised.

title: Simulate Custom 'simulate_custom' is the interface for pmsims at the most basic level. It performs no processing of arguments and allows all possible options to be customised. — simulate_custom
code: simulate_custom(   data_function = NULL,   model_function = NULL,   metric_function = NULL,   target_performance,   test_n = 30000,   min_sample_size,   max_sample_size,   n_reps_total = NULL,   n_reps_per = 50,   se_final = NULL,   n_init = 4,   method = "mlpwr",   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Simulate Custom 'simulate_custom' is the interface for pmsims at the most basic level. It performs no processing of arguments and allows all possible options to be customised. — simulate_custom
text: data_function function returns datasets. Must single argmument, n, controls sample size. model_function function fits models data. Take data object returned data_funciton argument. metric_function function returns performance metric. Must take test data, fitted model model function arguments. Must return single value. target_performance minimum desired model performance test_n sample size used test datasets. large number. min_sample_size minimum sample size assessed. sets lower bound search region sample size. max_sample_size maximum sample size assessed. sets upper bound search region sample size. n_reps_total total number simulation reps run pmsims. n_reps_per number reps run sample size. se_final standard error can used stopping criteria. Either n_reps_total se_final given. n_init number initial sample sizes used search alorithm passed method used method method used search minimum sample size. Options "mlpwr" "crude". verbose logical controlling output ... argments passed method function.
